net.derquinse.common.collect

Class ImmutableHierarchy<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.derquinse.common.collect.AbstractHierarchy<E>
      • net.derquinse.common.collect.ImmutableHierarchy<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - Type of the elements in the hierarchy.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Hierarchy<E>

    public abstract class ImmutableHierarchy<E>
extends AbstractHierarchy<E>
    An immutable and thread-safe implementation of hierarchy.
    Author:
    Andres Rodriguez

      static class  ImmutableHierarchy.Builder<E>
      Builder for immutable hierarchies.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static <E> ImmutableHierarchy<E> of()
        Returns an empty immutable hierarchy.

      • copyOf

        public static <E> ImmutableHierarchy<E> copyOf(Hierarchy<? extends E> hierarchy)
        Returns an immutable copy of the provided hierarchy. If the argument is itself an immutable hierarchy no copy is performed.
        Parameters:
        hierarchy - Hierarchy to copy.
        Returns:
        An immutable hierarchy equal to the the one provided.

      • builder

        public static <E> ImmutableHierarchy.Builder<E> builder()
        Returns a new builder that does not allow out of order insertion (initially).

      • builder

        public static <E> ImmutableHierarchy.Builder<E> builder(boolean outOfOrder)
        Returns a new builder.
        Parameters:
        outOfOrder - Whether to allow out of order insertion.

      • elementSet

        public abstract ImmutableSet<E> elementSet()
        Description copied from interface: Hierarchy
        Returns the set of distinct elements contained in this hierarchy.
        Returns:
        A set containing a live view the elements of the hierarchy.

      • getDescendants

        public final ImmutableSet<E> getDescendants(@Nullable
                             E element)
        Description copied from interface: Hierarchy
        Returns the descendants of the specified element.
        Parameters:
        element - Element which descendants are requested. If null the element set is returned.
        Returns:
        The set of descendants. Iteration order is unspecified.
